Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2014 08:38AM Bettina73 wrote: Akevia: Same problem here, almost 6 weeks with no hair, only this fuzz that you can see in the second picture. And starting Tamoxifen...Thanks for your compliments, its really great to hear some when we are bold....

Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2014 08:52AM Bettina73 wrote: Same here, but I did the dose dense taxol,last one september 25th...Only now I have a little fuzz...and white. But full coverage. Really short. I can't wait to get rid off my wig. It is summer here in Brasil plus I'm having those sweats from chemo...My kids (12 year old twins) say that my hair looks like a carpet...Two inches is like two fingers? Because we use centimeters here and I have almost one (One finger) of thin hair coming. Best, Bettina

Posts.Title: Hair growth after AC Akevia Akevia

Posts.Content: Nov 23, 2014 04:18PM Bettina73 wrote: Hey girls! Hello from Rio de Janeiro! Brasil!!!! I'm a 41 years old mother of twins and just finished chemo. I had surgery before and then adjuvant chemo. 4 cycles of AC every 2 weeks and 4 cycles of Taxol, every 2 weeks. Ihad what docs called dose dense. My last chemo was on september 25th and I still have baby hair. But gray. Yay!!!! I used to be blonde before and now I look like a white rabbit. It is taking to long to come back...I don't know if is causa I had the dose dense regimen... Anybody with the same issue? Now i'm on radio and have 14 sessions to go, plus tamoxifen... Picture taken after my first chemo - my real hair  And today:  Best  Bettina
Posts.Title: Hair growth after AC Akevia Akevia

Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2014 08:42AM Bettina73 wrote: Hi! How many cycles you did? It has been 8 weeks after my last chemo and I only have a little fuzz...But I think with targeted therapy your hair will grow fast, no problem. Best wishes for you!
Posts.Title: Hair growth after AC Akevia Akevia

Posts.Content: Nov 25, 2014 07:12AM Bettina73 wrote: Jules! Good news for you. My lashes and eyebrows fall out one month after my last chemo. grrrr!!!! I was looking like a zombie, no costume needed for Haloween's eve. hahaha. But one week later it was growing back soooo fast. I only stayed one week with no eyebrows. And same with my lashes. I used a crayon from MAC that was really simple to drawn my eyebrows plus an eyeshadow the same color to fill. Here is th name:Fling Eye Brows( crayon) and you pick the best color for you and I used some eye shadow with the brush number 266, from MAC also. It helped me a lot during this period. They are the last to fall and first to grow back. best
